results.description:
RSVP to [masked] 

Please come share your thoughts about:

What does love mean, to you…

 …in your family life…in your heritage/culture?

What have you learned about loving wisely and well?

How is love different for men and for women, for gay and straight folks, and for others – or is it essentially the same for all?

How does the meaning of love change as we get older?

What are the connections, for you, between love and sexuality?

Is love “natural” – or is it “socially-constructed”?

How is love effected by politics, class, and money?

Does loving make us healthier?

What’s one of your favorite works of art about Love (movie, play, poem, picture, song….)? 

Some suggested optional readings: On Love, Jose Ortega y Gasset; Love 2.0, Barbara Fredrickson; About Love, Robert Solomon; Philosophies of Love, David L. Norton and Mary F. Kille; Eat, Pray, Love, Elizabeth Gilbert; Why We Love, Helen Fisher; The Art of Loving, Erich Fromm; The Second Sex, Simone de Beauvoir; I and Thou, Martin Buber

Conversations New York

 (www.conversationsnewyork.com) is a community of volunteers which offers over 100 sparkling, meaningful conversations each month on its on-line calendar, conducts the annual Conversation Day in Bryant Park,  and organized , the first national symposium on The Power of Conversation, held at Columbia University .

Contact: Ronald Gross

[masked]

www.conversationsnewyork.com

About the Moderator: 

 Ron Gross is the founder of "Conversations New York." He's been organizing exciting, important CONVERSATIONS for 20 years, and currently holds them regularly on the Columbia University campus and elsewhere through the city. He's the author of 23 books on LIFELONG LEARNING. He was recently honored for lifetime achievement in the field by the International Society for Self-Directed Learning. The late Buckminster Fuller said of Ron's work: “If humanity is to pass safely through its present crisis on earth, it will be because a majority of individuals are now doing their own thinking. Ronald Gross’ work has pioneered in improving the climate for such thinking in the United States.”
results.how_to_find_us: 75 Varick Street – 2nd floor Subways: #1 to Canal; A, C. or E to Canal; J, N, Q, R, W, Z or #6 to Canal All these Canal Street, New York, NY.  Ask at Reception Desk on 2nd floor after checking in with Security in lobby, please.
results.name: "LOVE! - Share Your Thoughts" Conversation with Ron Gross. #CNY

Are you curious about how education is being reshaped by technology? This Meetup is perfect for techies with an education interest, teachers who are filling their classrooms with tech, and anyone who wants to get involved in one of the industries with the largest growth potential within tech. The ed tech industry received nearly $3 billion in investment in 2015, up from $1.87 billion in 2014 -- yet our schools are not transforming fast enough to keep up with today's rapidly changing job market.

Come hear from some of today's hottest edtech startups and tech-saavy teachers to learn about how technology will transform education forever.

------

Code/Bronx Info Session (4:30pm - 5pm):

Code/Bronx launched in winter 2015 with the Bronx Borough President and Code/Interactive to bring coding programs to every school in the Bronx. Come learn about upcoming professional development events and opportunities to get a coding class in your school. ------

results.description:
Scroll down to read about our full list of EdTech demos below from Newsela, EverFi, Buncee, and ReadWorks.

Are you curious about how education is being reshaped by technology?  This Meetup is perfect for techies with an education interest, teachers who are filling their classrooms with tech, and anyone who wants to get involved in one of the industries with the largest growth potential within tech.


The ed tech industry received nearly $3 billion in investment in 2015, up from $1.87 billion in 2014 -- yet our schools are not transforming fast enough to keep up with today's rapidly changing job market.

Come hear from some of today's hottest edtech startups and tech-saavy teachers to learn about how technology will transform education forever.

------

Code/Bronx Info Session (4:30pm - 5pm):

Code/Bronx launched in winter 2015 with the Bronx Borough President and Code/Interactive to bring coding programs to every school in the Bronx.  Come learn about upcoming professional development events and opportunities to get a coding class in your school. 

------

Tentative Schedule:

4:00pm: Networking and Food

4:30pm: Code/Bronx Info Session

5:00pm: Networking, Food, and Code/Bronx Sign-Up

5:30pm: Education Technology Demos

6:30pm: Networking and Food

------

EdTech Demos: 

Newsela - @newsela

Newsela is an education technology startup dedicated to transforming the way learners access the world through words. The founding team members combine powerful technological know-how with real-world experience earned in the classroom, the newsroom, and the boardroom. Launched in June 2013, Newsela publishes high-interest news articles daily at five levels of complexity for grades 2-12 using Newsela’s proprietary, rapid text-leveling process. Common Core–aligned quizzes attached to articles give educators and parents insight into their students’ reading strengths and weaknesses. Newsela develops nonfiction fluency and critical-thinking skills necessary to master the Common Core standards for informational text.

EverFi - @everfi

EverFi is an education technology company that partners with corporations and foundations to provide online learning courses to schools at no cost. EverFi’s courses aim to engage and teach students in a variety of critical skills such as STEM readiness, coding, entrepreneurship, financial literacy and digital literacy/citizenship. Our co-curricular, digital courses deliver content that engages 21st century learners by leveraging gamification, simulations, and assessments. Our standards-aligned courses provide meaningful metrics to teachers by not only measuring knowledge gains, but also student attitudes on these important skills. 

Buncee - @buncee

Buncee is a web-based creation and presentation tool that allows students and teachers to create engaging and interactive presentations, lesson plans, digital stories, research projects, and more using their in-house graphics and multimedia resources. Buncee has been integral in enhancing student engagement and creativity in classrooms within all 50 states in the US, as well as 127 countries worldwide.

ReadWorks - @readworks

The ReadWorks team is excited to unveil our new digital technology platform to the edTech meetup community. The new platform will begin serving teachers, students, and parents in 1-to-1 and blended learning environments this spring. The nonprofit ReadWorks is the leading venture in the United States for improving teacher effectiveness and student learning in reading comprehension. 
ReadWorks provides the largest, highest-quality library of authentic nonfiction and literary articles in the country for K-12 students, along with carefully-selected vocabulary, formative assessment questions, and cognitive-science based reading comprehension lessons - all aligned to the Common Core and state standards. ReadWorks is free and meant to be shared broadly. With our current, non-digital website, ReadWorks has more than 650,000 active teacher users in more than 65,000 U.S. public schools, with 2,000 new teacher registrants joining every day. Additionally, 60% of our active users are in public schools where more than half of the students qualify for free and reduced lunch.

results.description:
Today’s interfaces are beyond "point and click". We swipe, scroll, pinch, resize, drag, drop and more. What these interactions have in common is they transform continuous user input into continuously updating layout - often times in richly coordinated ways. These use-cases have outgrown CSS-only solutions. In this talk we’ll discuss how JavaScript can help, and how to think of layout in terms of streams and reactive programming. We will also present SamsaraJS, a JavaScript library for stream-based layout.

David was the Chief Architect of Famo.us, a SF startup building a framework for mobile web apps. Before that he got a PhD in math from UCSB.
results.name: Layout and Animation with Streams - David Valdman

Register on our site to reserve your seat:

http://civicrm.fatcatfablab.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=13<a href="http://civicrm.fatcatfablab.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=13"></a>

Cost: $50 for members, $75 for non-members.

We'll start with a prepared g-code file and cover the basic usage and safety for our Camaster Stinger 1 CNC machine.

Prerequisites:  There aren't any prerequisites for the class, but know that without prior CAD/CAM knowledge and a post-processor for our machine, you may not get to use this information on your own projects for a while.

Please note, you may cancel your class booking up to 24 hours before the event. Value can not be refunded, but credited towards a future class of the same type.

FYI we're using Autodesk Fusion 360 for CAD/CAM and will have classes on that in the future. Let us know what CAD/CAM you have and we'll check with Camaster for a post-processor.

results.description:
REGISTRATION IS CLOSED FOR THIS SOLD-OUT EVENT!

Call[masked] for more information!


Learn all about the Business of Sports from a panel of industry experts, and stay for a Westchester Knicks basketball game!

Did you know there is an extensive sports industry in Westchester County?Learn who they are, what they do, and why they are doing business in Westchester! Find out how to connect with the growing sports industry in Westchester!


Program includes networking, a panel discussion with local and national experts and VIP tickets to a Westchester Knicks Game! 

5:00 PM Panel, 7:00 PM Game 

Panelist include:

Joel Fisher, Executive Vice President, Sports Properties, Madison Square Garden

Mr. Fisher's tenure at Madison Square Garden has spanned over three decades touching many of the company's core business assets. Today, Fisher continues to oversee the final stages of the Transformation and all Madison Square Garden Real Estate projects as well as overseeing the day-to-day operations of MSG Sports Properties.

Tom Laidlaw, Former Ranger and Owner, Laidlaw Sports Management
Mr. Laidlaw has been a leading agent for both National Hockey League and Europe-based players for two decades. His Laidlaw Sports Management business in located in Rye, N.Y. and offers players a full service program, including contract negotiation, likeness marketing, and career counseling.  Before entering the business world, Laidlaw was a NHL defenseman for 10 seasons with the New York Rangers and Los Angeles Kings from[masked] to 1989-90. 

Dave Torromeo, Director, Sport Business Management Program at Manhattanville College and former Vice President, National Football Foundation & College Hall of Fame 
Mr. Torromeo has worked in nearly every capacity of the sports world, from a minor league team, to a D-I athletic program and the Football Foundation.  He is also a consultant to the sports industry and the founder of Future Sports Business Executives.

Gene Westmoreland, Assistant Executive Director/Tournament Director, Metro Golf Association
Mr. Westmoreland began his career with the MGA in 1978 assisting the field team with championships on a part-time basis.  In addition to his duties at the MGA, Westmoreland is a rules of golf columnist for The Met Golfer and Suburban Golfer.

Leif Skodnick, Sports Planning Editor, The Journal News (MODERATOR)
Mr. Skodnick oversee story production for online and print editions, manage the production staff, and use news judgement to determine the placement of content in print and online for maximum exposure. He. Manages an eight-person sports staff covering local issues in sports, high school sports over a three-county area, as well as the New York Yankees and New York Rangers.
results.name: Business of... Sports

results.description:
Atlas Chen, an indie game designer who is currently working on his game, Gemini, will be in the house to talk about PACING the level design of single-player games. 

Level design is a very complicated subject. Pacing is the core art of designing good levels in games of progression such as Uncharted, Journey, and Super Mario Brothers. 

Pacing includes 

• the arrangement of difficulty

• gameplay intensity, drama conflicts

• visual/audio elements

• elements of novalty and more!

Proper pacing keeps the player engaging in the levels that you design and leads to a satisfaction overall gameplay and narrative experience.

Atlas, who has been designing since 2002, will do a short level design exercise and give us a glimpse into his creative process.
results.name: Slow Down or Speed Up: How Pacing Affects Level Design

A FREE and mostly vegan community meals we make together with love, mostly using food we rescued from the trash. We share meal planning, cooking, and other food prep skills, tell stories and jokes, meet new people and reconnect with old friends, and generally unplug from the current world order as we build community. If you are not a skilled cook, it is OK! If you are, that’s great! You can plan a dish or two from the ingredients we have on hand, and get help if you want it. Media WILL be welcome with appointment, but journalists will be required to respect the wishes of those who do not want to be photographed.

It will be held at a volunteer’s home accessible by NYC Transit. RSVP (at least a day ahead) to Janet at (347)[masked] for the location. We’ll meet at 5:30pm to begin cooking and preparation.

results.description:
The New York Songwriters Collective's 

￼“Collective Song Club”   Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

The "Collective Song Club” meets every other Wednesday evening. You will receive advance notice if  holidays. inclement weather or other circumstances make the day or week change.

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com) 

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. Leave when you need!   We listen to songs in the order members arrive so earlier is usually better!


The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.


There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!

All MeetUp group members may attend a first Song Club session without having to become a full Collective member. After your first session the Collective requires that you become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

results.description:
We are thrilled to have Noah Smith in to speak to students and community about starting and working at a startup, and about opportunities for entrepreneurship (and things to look out for) at the intersection of finance and technology.

Noah has founded several companies, most recently Open Capital Exchange, a marketplace lender for small businesses. Among other things he is currently working with ClearFctr, a financial modeling software company, and is advising several other early stage companies.

Previously, Noah worked in private equity, where he led the execution of controlling investments numerous companies and was actively involved in overseeing portfolio company management. Noah was also part of the early team at business intelligence firm ChinaLaw (now part of Thomson Reuters) in Beijing, where he also worked as a journalist and started the first American-style brunch in the Chinese capital.
results.name: Startup Talk: Noah Smith, FinTech Entrepreneur & 3x Founder

Join us for 2-hour Shamanic Breathwork workshop every Wednesday 5:45pm-7:45pm at the NY Open Center.   2016  In this Shamanic Breathwork™ workshop you will experience healing that draws on the wisdom of Shamanic practices and contemporary psycho-spiritual models.   This experience will allow you to  connect with the shaman within and access the power of healing and transformation using  breath and music. People who experience  Shamanic Breathwork report an increase in physical and emotional well-being.  We will be using the breath and chackra attunes music to go through a powerful shamanic journey, heal and release energies that no longer serve you and open to a deeper connection with spirit guides, your inner-guidance and power.  

Fee for one session:  $35

Special offer:  Register for 3 sessions and get the 4th free.  (a saving of $35)

To register call the NY Open Center at[masked]-2527.  If you choose to drop in, please arrive early to register at the front desk.  

If you have any question, don't hesitate to call me at[masked] or write me at [masked]. for more information at  http://www.opencenter.org/events/shamanic-breathwork-drop-in-classes-2/

or http://www.simpletruthwithin.com/upcoming-events/ 

Looking forward to seeing you and have you part of our community.

Smadar

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
It’s February now, and with Valentine’s Day fast approaching I’m thinking of all the ways to celebrate my first love - the outdoors! And there is no better way to do that than to share it with you. So, you should take advantage, and use this opportunity to join us at an open house in our NYC office next to Central Park! It doesn't matter if you're totally new to AMC, just joined, or are a veteran of the club; everyone is welcome to attend! We will be giving a quick presentation about the AMC
and the activities the New York-North Jersey Chapter offer. Bring your questions if you have them and we'll give you all of the information needed to get outdoors. You'll get a chance to meet and socialize with some experienced members of the club and ask them about what makes them passionate about the AMC and what got them involved. Light refreshments will be provided.

Space is limited so please register soon, you MUST email [masked] to register for this event.

To learn more about the Appalachian Mountain Club please visit www.outdoors.org
results.name: Learn about the AMC at our February Open House!

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
Dear Fearless Entrepreneurs,

As entrepreneurs, our greatest challenge is sales. We must know 
how to sell effectively. Don’t cower in fear just yet. Sales need not be petrifying.  In fact, sales and sales improvement can be easy, enjoyable, and prosperous.

In our next meeting you will learn:

1. The Entrepreneur Mindset
2. The Power Sales Mindset
3. 6 Steps to a Master Sales System
4. Achieve by Knowing Where You’re Going
5. Sales Blast Through Your Calendar

I look forward to seeing you then.

Frank Coppola
Your Fearless Entrepreneur Organizer

We will follow a structured format :

6:30-7:00pm - Registration/Open Networking

7:00-7:15pm - Introduce yourself to the group in elevator pitch

6:45-7:15 pm - Interactive educational presentation

7:15-7:30 pm - Brainstorm and Master-Mind  Interaction

7:30- 8:00 pm - Connect yourself to your perfect referrals 

Please provide a link to your company

About the Speaker:

Frank Coppola is an author, speaker, business income accelerator, and entrepreneurial coach with over twenty years of business experience, psychotherapy training and ADD ADHD focus expertise. Using his proven, solution-oriented, proprietary system for success "Get Into Action - 8 Simple Steps To Clarity, Focus and Income,"™ Frank works with entrepreneurs and small businesses owners to achieve their goals and obtain astounding results. He specializes in empowering entrepreneurs to stay focused on their brand, be more organized and manage their time effectively, overcome procrastination and generate more clients, income and profit...faster. Frank Coppola loves seeing people succeed at what they love to do.

“Using Frank’s expert guidance, I took a stalled project from $0.00 to $121,465 in less than 12 weeks.”
Stephanie Frank, Author, “Accidental Millionaire. You’re Not Crazy . . . You’re an Entrepreneur

“I generated the entire amount of money I made all of last year within 5 months”
Bob Kopp, Financial Advisor

“Frank’s work with entrepreneurs, solopreneurs, and people dealing with procrastination, time management, organization, clarity and focus is groundbreaking.”
David Giwerc, MCC, MCAC, BCC, Founder, President of ADD Coach Academy

* *Please RSVP and pay $10.00 to register now or $20.00 at the door. This event will fill up quickly so reserve you place today!**

Be sure to introduce yourself by joining the conversation.

Look forward to meeting you all in person.

Frank

results.description:
Yea! It's the 3rd anniversary of Death Café! 

THE SCENE:


This month Nancy hosts solo, placing you at tables of 4 in a private room, with free-flowing conversation over pots of Moroccan tea and small plates - unhindered by facilitators, speakers or agendas. Still in deep conversation at 7:30? Stay longer (but thank our hosts by ordering additional dishes or a drink from the bar).

SOUNDBITES FROM OUR TABLES: 

There are so many terrific conversations going on at Death Café NYC.  If you would like to share one of those comments on  Soundbites from Our Tables (it's one of our Death Café NYC Meetup.com pages),  please share it with Nancy; post it on our Facebook page, or email us through Meetup.com so we can add them to the collection.

FACEBOOK: 

LIKE Death Café NYC on Facebook to get some of the brain-sharpening items and announcements we don’t email you through Meetup.com:  

 News you can use (and haven't heard before)   Discount tickets to lecture series, art talks and more  Live film screenings including Q&As with the directors   Early peeks at upcoming exhibitions (such as the Metropolitan Museum of Art/ Costume Institute's show, “Death Becomes Her”) 

See you soon!

Audrey and Nancy

This is not a class but a unique immersive experience where we help you fix your pitch - thanks to the guided expertise of many seasoned minds. If you have participated in a Startupalooza, this event will help you improve your rankings. 

This event is Free for all Startupalooza attendees

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will ever experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about, plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a couple blocks away.

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment!

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
results.name: The Friendliest NYC After Work Happy Hour & Social Networking Party ~ Free Event

All experience levels are welcome, from absolute beginners to seasoned consultants looking for extra practice.

Our group is open to students and professionals across the globe.

results.description:
At a Glance:
Creative pros share their stories of how social media has impacted their careers, plus their tips for networking online, building a personal brand, and using your online presence to land the job.

Who You’ll Meet
- Andrew AskedallCreative Director – Digital Products, MakerBot
- Natalie Amrossi, Photographer, Misshattan
- Eric Di MonteSenior Talent Acquistion Manager, Univision
- Mia Hall, Speaker and Career Transition Consultant, Mia Hall 19
- Emily Miethner, CEO + Founder, FindSpark

Why Attend?
- You want to feel less intimidated by all the possibilities of social media.
- You want to learn more about the possibilities of LinkedIn.
- You want to know how to land the job in 140 characters or less.
- You want to build a strong personal brand online.
- You want to hear real stories of how creative pros have found success.
- You want to connect with like-minded pros, both young and established.

How it Works:
- Social media pros will tell their stories of how their online presence helped them build their brand and get their dream job.
- Then, you can ask them your questions on building your personal brand online during small, intimate breakout sessions.

Dress: Business Casual
Hashtag: #FindSpark
Tickets: $5-$20 (includes pizza!) depending on your FindSpark membership level & career status
results.name: Next Level Personal Branding: Social Media & Your Career

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
Deep Energy Retrofits: NYC is a series of presentations focusing on deep retrofit strategies for existing buildings that will help achieve NYC's 80x50 GHG reduction targets. Each session showcases a retrofit project of an existing building representing aspecific New York City typology. Participants can use these case studies as tools to meet 80 x 50 reduction targets in other existing buildings.  


Learn how an 1899 Brooklyn row house became NYC's first Passive House-certified home through renovations that relied on energy modeling, integrative design, air tightness, and performance metrics. The architect, builder, and passive house consultant will speak in detail about how the work was accomplished and how this case study has informed subsequent projects.

NYPH is a proud Event Sponsor of this event.

- Click Here to Register - 

- SPEAKERS - 

Julie Torres Moskovitz, AIA, LEED AP, CPHT, Founding Principal, Fete Nature Architecture, PLLC

Julie Torres Moskovitz is principal architect at FNA and was lead designer on Tighthouse, the first certified passive house in NYC, and a retrofit of an 1899 rowhouse. She is author of Princeton Architectural Press’ The Greenest Home, which features 18 Passive House case studies. She recently formed a joint venture with Belgian Architect Sebastian Moreno-Vacca, an architect who is at the center of Belgian’s sustainable success story—an initiative that has resulted in millions of square feet of passive house buildings in just five years.


Jordan Goldman, Founding Principal, Zero Energy Design


Jordan Goldman is a specialist in energy modeling, mechanical engineering, and manages the HVAC design practice for ZeroEnergy Design. He is fluent in building envelope strategies and energy efficient construction systems, building science design principles, as well as mechanical system design, specification, and sizing for enhanced energy performance. Jordan has been recognized by the EPA for his achievement in systems design for green buildings and has been featured on NPR. He is a Certified Passive House Consultant, LEED Accredited Professional, and HERS Rater. 


Kevin Brennan, Building Science Consultant & Trainer, Passive House Academy


Kevin Brennan is a PHI certified passive house tradesperson, BPI retrofit Installer, ABAA auditor and ABAA self adhered / fluid applied air barrier installer. For the past 3 years, Kevin has been delivering the PHI certified passive house tradesperson courses in the bronx at AEA's hands on passive house training facility. Kevin is an instructor for the Air Barrier Association of America.

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: Deep Energy Retrofit: Row House (UGC Event)

results.description:
Event organized by EARTH (Environmentalist Animal Rights Team of Hoboken)

NOTE: The restaurant for this event has been changed from Karma Kafe to Satay on 1st St and Washington St due to the fire that struck the building where Karma Kafe is located. The meeting time has also been changed to 6:00 pm. If you cannot make it at that time, please come when you can. We will be there until 8:00 pm (and possibly later depending on how long they let us linger).

We all know it's difficult (well, impossible) to find entirely vegan places in Hoboken/Jersey City. One of the nice things about ethnic food is that a lot of times it can easily be made vegan! Satay has many options that are already vegan and various options that can easily be made vegan. Please see images below of the menu. 


The highlighted items are those that are vegan or can be made vegan. Anything circled is an item that may not be vegan (ex. sauces) and anything underlined is something that should be omitted from the dish. This highlighted menu will be provided on Wednesday for further viewing as it is difficult to read the items in the photos above. Of course, if there is anything you are unsure of, please do not hesitate to clarify with the server! The menu can be viewed online here. They have two menus, but the one they use for those dining in is the Malaysian menu.

Satay has great reviews! It is rated 4/5 on TripAdvisor and  3.5/5 on Yelp. One reviewer stated: "We go to Satay often and we absolutely love this place. Over the years we have taken family and friends and every single time they all leave happy and satisfied with Malasyan Cuisine. Love it!"

Another customer stated: "Great Malaysian spot - affordable prices and authentic and flavorful food."


The purpose of the event is not only to socialize and enjoy a delicious meal with like-minded people (which is always fun!), but also to show restaurants like Satay that there is a demand for more vegan food in Hoboken, and that we want more vegan options as well as a more clearly labeled vegan menu. At the very least, vegans shouldn't have to stress out about what to order and should be able to go to restaurants with the peace of mind knowing there are clearly marked vegan options so they don't have to ask the waiter a million questions in front of their friends...we've all been there. Thus, the more people who show up to this event, the more likely we are to make some progress in this regard!


So come on out for some delicious food, great company, and some subtle activism!


Also, this event is open to vegans, vegetarians, pescetarians, veg-curious, omnivores, carnivores, etc! In fact, we encourage you to invite your non vegan friends! However, please order vegan at the restaurant and encourage anyone who may not be vegan to do so as well.
results.how_to_find_us: Come inside the restaurant and we will be at the tables holding a "meetup" sign.
results.name: Vegan Dinner at Satay Malaysian Cuisine

Create Your Unique Social Conversation that Sells

This workshop is for those women business owners and heart-centered entrepreneurs who hate the pushy sales pitch they think they need to have in order to sell their product or service. 

Whether you are an expert, a coach, a consultant, a network marketing independent business owner or service provider, this workshop is designed to help you step into your success with an authentic heart felt social conversation that will convert to sales. 

You will learn

- The 3 secrets to designing an irresistible offer
- The no cost actions you can take right away to sell more
- How to design a presentation that leads to your irresistible offer, and finally;
- How to craft your own unique social conversation that will convert to more sales


Get Your FREE Ticket today.  Only 15 seats available. 

SPECIAL NOTE:  Your ticket is considered a reservation.  We are only allowing 15 people to attend so that each participant will get the full measure and value that the workshop provides.

results.description:
RSVP to [masked] 

Please come share your thoughts about:

What does love mean, to you…

 …in your family life…in your heritage/culture?

What have you learned about loving wisely and well?

How is love different for men and for women, for gay and straight folks, and for others – or is it essentially the same for all?

How does the meaning of love change as we get older?

What are the connections, for you, between love and sexuality?

Is love “natural” – or is it “socially-constructed”?

How is love effected by politics, class, and money?

Does loving make us healthier?

What’s one of your favorite works of art about Love (movie, play, poem, picture, song….)? 

Some suggested optional readings: On Love, Jose Ortega y Gasset; Love 2.0, Barbara Fredrickson; About Love, Robert Solomon; Philosophies of Love, David L. Norton and Mary F. Kille; Eat, Pray, Love, Elizabeth Gilbert; Why We Love, Helen Fisher; The Art of Loving, Erich Fromm; The Second Sex, Simone de Beauvoir; I and Thou, Martin Buber

Conversations New York

 (www.conversationsnewyork.com) is a community of volunteers which offers over 100 sparkling, meaningful conversations each month on its on-line calendar, conducts the annual Conversation Day in Bryant Park,  and organized , the first national symposium on The Power of Conversation, held at Columbia University .

Contact: Ronald Gross

[masked]

www.conversationsnewyork.com

About the Moderator: 

 Ron Gross is the founder of "Conversations New York." He's been organizing exciting, important CONVERSATIONS for 20 years, and currently holds them regularly on the Columbia University campus and elsewhere through the city. He's the author of 23 books on LIFELONG LEARNING. He was recently honored for lifetime achievement in the field by the International Society for Self-Directed Learning. The late Buckminster Fuller said of Ron's work: “If humanity is to pass safely through its present crisis on earth, it will be because a majority of individuals are now doing their own thinking. Ronald Gross’ work has pioneered in improving the climate for such thinking in the United States.”
results.name: "LOVE! - Share Your Thoughts" - Conversation with Ron Gross. #CNY

group.name: FREE: YOGA,MEDITATION,SPIRITUAL KNOWLEDGE & FIND TRUTH IN US

Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you...no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Jersey City and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.


During this game you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.


Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

This meet up is by invitation only, so you need to answer the questions in the RSVP for us to be able to contact you with the details of this event.


http://www.youtube.com/v/uqZayPhdUJc?version=3
results.name: Learn REI strategies by playing CashFlow game

results.description:
This free workshop teaches how to use the compass in interaction with a map. If you are hiking on marked trails or bushwhacking to areas not far from trails, a good topographic map may be the only tool you need to plan and maintain your route. If you are planning to be in the wilderness for an extended period of time, you will most likely be using a compass to help you find your way.

COMPASS AND PENCIL REQUIRED. PLEASE DO NOT USE A SMART PHONE APPLICATION

Instructor: Hank Osborn - East Hudson Program Coordinator for the NY-NJ Trail Conference.

Seats are limited

Contact Jamie Lipman Abish @ email - [masked]

You must register with Tents and Trails by emailing Jamie so please do so right after you RSVP to claim your spot as they are limited.

results.description:
RSVP to [masked] 

Please come share your thoughts about:


What does love mean, to you…

 …in your family life…in your heritage/culture?

What have you learned about loving wisely and well?

How is love different for men and for women, for gay and straight folks, and for others – or is it essentially the same for all?

How does the meaning of love change as we get older?

What are the connections, for you, between love and sexuality?

Is love “natural” – or is it “socially-constructed”?

How is love effected by politics, class, and money?

Does loving make us healthier?

What’s one of your favorite works of art about Love (movie, play, poem, picture, song….)? 


Some suggested optional readings: On Love, Jose Ortega y Gasset; Love 2.0, Barbara Fredrickson; About Love, Robert Solomon; Philosophies of Love, David L. Norton and Mary F. Kille; Eat, Pray, Love, Elizabeth Gilbert; Why We Love, Helen Fisher; The Art of Loving, Erich Fromm; The Second Sex, Simone de Beauvoir; I and Thou, Martin Buber

Conversations New York

 (www.conversationsnewyork.com) is a community of volunteers which offers over 100 sparkling, meaningful conversations each month on its on-line calendar, conducts the annual Conversation Day in Bryant Park,  and organized , the first national symposium on The Power of Conversation, held at Columbia University .

Contact: Ronald Gross

[masked]

www.conversationsnewyork.com

About the Moderator: 

 Ron Gross is the founder of "Conversations New York." He's been organizing exciting, important CONVERSATIONS for 20 years, and currently holds them regularly on the Columbia University campus and elsewhere through the city. He's the author of 23 books on LIFELONG LEARNING. He was recently honored for lifetime achievement in the field by the International Society for Self-Directed Learning. The late Buckminster Fuller said of Ron's work: “If humanity is to pass safely through its present crisis on earth, it will be because a majority of individuals are now doing their own thinking. Ronald Gross’ work has pioneered in improving the climate for such thinking in the United States.”
results.name: "LOVE! - Share Your Thoughts" Conversation with Ron Gross. #CNY

results.description:
On Wednesday night, February 17, at the VFW Hall in Clifton, NJVA will present Matt


Schneider from Technicolor PostWorks in NYC, who will be making a presentation about the proper workflow for shooting and editing in cinema 4K and UHD.


The presentation will include various editing systems, cameras and codecs ... everything and anything you need to know about shooting and editing properly in 4K.


Want to find out how much computer power you need?Is Mac better than PC? Which camera codecs are best suited? What about editing with proxy files and conforming afterwards? Matt can answer any question about any topic on digital video and 4K

Who is Matt Schneider?


Matthew Schneider leads the research and workflow development effort at Technicolor PostWorks Testlab in New York City. PostWorks Technicolor is the largest digital video post production facility of its kind on the East Coast.


Matt assists clients in workflow design and implementation, and other issues related to digital camera systems and formats. He also serves as liaison to Avid and other technology manufacturers to assist in product development and customer support.


Prior to joining Technicolor PostWorks New York in 2003, Schneider worked as a support engineer for Avid Technology, where he assisted with large-scale broadcast network deployments and workflow design for feature film and television clients. He is an active member of SMPTE New York and the Sony Cine-Alta User Group.


DETAILS:


Meeting around 7 p.m., with networking starting at 6:15 p.m. Refreshments served.


Clifton VFW, 491 Valley Road, Clifton, NJ.


Don't forget to pay your 2016 dues – only $99 – which entitles you to free attendance at all  2016 meetings, including the holiday party in December.


Or sign up for the Feb. 17 meeting -- $25 as a guest.
results.name: Everything You Want to Know about 4k and Sony Cameras

results.description:
RSVP to [masked] 

As you enjoy your holiday victuals, please give some food for thought, and plan to join us on Wednesday, January 20th, to share your experiences, reflections, feelings and convictions about FOOD.

What does Food mean to you?

What role does Food play in your social life and relationships?

What attitudes about food did you "ingest" from your heritage and culture, your upbringing and life-experiences?

What issues do you have about Food and our Health?

How does Food figure in your reading/entertainment/popular culture (celebrity chefs, etc.) 

Do you have any  moral or ethical convictions about Food -- around how it is produced, marketed, and distributed; hunger and poverty; sustainability and global warming... ("Let them eat cake!")

results.description:
Fun fact: Businesses that are online are expected to grow 40% faster than those that aren’t.

Join Greater Newark Enterprises Corporation (GNEC), ForwardEver Sustainable Business Alliance, RisingTide Capital, NJIT Enterprise Development Center (EDC) in conjunction with Google for a workshop to help customers find your business. You'll update your business info (address, services, hours of operation etc) on Google Search and Maps, build a free website, and more. Businesses with complete listings online are twice as likely to be considered reputable. At this workshop we will help you find out what your listing looks like when customers search for your business on Google Search and Maps. This is also an opportunity for you to network with other local businesses and learn about the incredible resources available at the EDC and from all of our partners. 

Refreshments will be served

What are you waiting for? 

RSVP HERE http://bit.ly/1R7elXf to set your business up for success in 2016.
results.name: Putting Your Business on the Map - Get Found on Google Search and Maps

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT. PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE.

Chet Kanojia, Starry

Chet Kanojia is co-founder and CEO of Starry, a Boston- and New York City-based startup making Internet better for everyone, from easy-to-use Wi-Fi products to radical Internet service.

See recent press for Starry in CNET and Tech Insider.

In addition to Starry, Chet is the founder and CEO of Project Decibel and Aereo, Inc., the groundbreaking online television platform that enabled consumers to record and watch live HD broadcast television on virtually any type of Internet-connected device via a cloud-based OTA antenna and DVR.

Previously, Chet was the founder and CEO of Navic Networks. Like Aereo, Navic Networks addressed the challenges of today’s highly fragmented media landscape. Under Chet’s direction, Navic Networks grew to be the undisputed industry leader in advanced television advertising. Navic Networks was subsequently acquired by Microsoft in 2008.

Chet, who holds more than 14 patents in fields ranging from robotics to data communications systems, is an innovative leader known for pushing beyond the conventional and developing breakthrough solutions. He has been recognized as one of "Top Disruptors of 2013" by Forbes magazine, noted as part of Vanity Fair's 2013 "Next Establishment List” and named one of Inc. Magazine’s 2013 “Entrepreneurs of the Year.”  Aereo's technology was also named one of TIME magazine's Top 50 Best Websites (2012) and a Top 50 Technology (2013) by MIT Technology Review.

Chet holds a master's degree in Computer Systems Engineering from Northeastern University and a bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology in Bhopal, India.

Agenda

6:30 Networking and Food
7:00 Fireside Chat
8:00 Networking

Hosted By Peter Crysdale, New York City Chapter Director

Peter is the Founder/CEO of StrategyHack, running marketing strategy hackathons for startups and professional marketers. He has a diverse background with 8+ years experience spanning engineering, social good and technology startups. In his spare time, he enjoys day dreaming and cross country skiing.  
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @PCrysdale

Hosted By Joshua Ness, Co-Director

Josh is a growth strategist in the New York City startup community. He used to produce global events for the likes of Microsoft. Now he helps marketing teams learn to think like startups.
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @jcness


Global Partners

</a> Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Local Partners

<a href="http://pivotal.io/labs"> Pivotal Labs consists of fellow practitioners and startup veterans who have a history of solving problems with early stage companies.

</a> <a href="http://www.strategyhack.org">StrategyHack teaches marketers to be leaders in problem-solving and strategy development through a live-action, hands-on workshop with real startups.

<a href="http://devonpr.com"></a> The Devon Group designs and delivers measurable PR and marketing programs that enable organizations to build credibility for products, services and ventures, generate qualified sales leads, and stake claims to new markets. Find out what the Devon difference can do for your company. Our services and offerings are crafted to help your organization polish your message, reach existing audiences while finding new ones, get your messaging to resonate with customers, media, and analysts, and reach beyond your goals. After 20+ years in business, The Devon Group knows a thing or two about finding your voice and maximizing the potential of your message. Contact our team of senior practitioners today to find out what services we have to offer your organization.

Upcoming events you should attend!

</a> New York City hosts <a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/19345349461">Gerard Adams Elite Daily 1st of March 2016

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 150 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
results.name: Startup Grind New York City Hosts Chet Kanojia (Starry)

results.description:
This post is only for announcement purposes

PLEASE RSVP FOR THIS EVENT HERE

Overview: 


We are excited to invite you to the NYC Hortonworks User Group pre-Spark Summit Meetup. Come hear about the latest innovations in Spark and Zeppelin that are accelerating Data Science. We will have great food and drinks to get the creative juices flowing and then we will move into our exciting agenda.

Agenda

6:30 - Networking and Food & Drinks


7:00 - Kick-Off

7:10 - Integration of Apache Spark and Apache NiFi

Oleg Zhurakousky, Hortonworks Architect

Description:

An overview of Apache NiFi and how it can be used to quickly, easily and securely deliver data to an analytic platform like Apache Spark.

7:40 - Multi-user Data Science with Apache Zeppelin

Vinay Shukla, Hortonworks Product Manager

Description:

A growing community of data scientists are now using Zeppelin. However IT is struggling to support them in a secure fashion.  The IT requirements are to provide authentication and authorization so that data scientist don’t step on each other’s work and also IT security requirements are met.

We will talk about recent Zeppelin improvements and how security can be configured to provide a secure Zeppelin service.


8:10 - Meet Hortonworks Spark Team: Ask me anything session on Spark and/or Spark in HDP

Ram Sriharsha, Hortonworks Architect

Vinay Shukla, Hortonworks Product Manager


8:40 - Questions & Answer

8:50 - Networking

we will have Hortonworks staff on hand to answer any questions, there will be a raffle and giveaways. Thanks to our sponsors NYC Storm User Group and Lifion by ADP for providing a venue!
results.how_to_find_us: 18th Street btwn (6th & 7th Ave)
results.name: Accelerating Data Science with Spark and Zeppelin

results.description:
BECOME THE BANK

Learn what to look for after you receive your collateral. What does a recorded assignment of mortgage look like? How do you know if your chain is complete? What is an allonge? This part of the business can be difficult for even the more experienced level note buyers. So we will go through a couple of actual files so you can gain some hands on experience.

These are just some of the topics that will be covered and we will hold an open Q&A at the end of each meetup. Our goal is that you understand this information well enough that you will be able to apply it on future purchases or with your existing portfolio.

HOST:
This event is being hosted by Mahir Allan of MJS Financial

TIME IS PRECIOUS: Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

ADMISSION: 
This event is limited to a max of 25 people.  If you plan on attending, please RSVP NOW! 

- FREE - First 20 RSVP

- $10 - 21 - 25 People

results.name: NYC MEETUP: Purchasing a Distressed Mortgage Note? What is Collateral?

Contact us if you have any questions. We hope to see you at the studio on 2/17/16 

Please note : the Price is $60 for this shoot, a $20 deposit is required to reserve your spot.  See payment details below for more information regarding payments.


Gabriella 

(photos supplied by model)

Age: 22  Height: 5' 6"  Weight: 104  lbs  Bust: 32"  Waist: 24"Hips: 32"  Cup: C  


Dress: 0  Shoe: 7.0  Hair color: Black  Hair Length: Long  Eye Color: Brown

Lighting Equipment, Props and Furniture

* Seamless paper (white or gray) (Subject to availability) 

* Props (Bench, couch, apple crates, wooden stool and step ladder) (Subject to availability) 

Additional Info

Part 1 is the $20 payment to reserve your spot which needs to be completed by Tuesday, February 16th through Paypal at [masked] 

Part 2 is $40 which must be paid in cash at the door immediately upon arrival to the event.

Payment options

1.  Send Paypal payment to [masked]  

2.  Stop by the studio any day from 11-6pm and pay cash

3.  Pay at the door on the day of the shoot $75 cash

============================================== 


Refund Policy 

All sales are finals. If a model doesn't show up, either an alternate model will be used or the remaining model will pose for both sessions.  Refunds will be given only if the event gets cancelled or all models are a no show.

============================================== 

Private shoots are available!!

Private shoots must be booked in advance.  

30 MINUTE PRIVATE SHOOT times are from 5-5:30 / 5:40-6:10pm or  8:40-9:10pm  on the day of the shoot

* 30 minute private shoot.  $75

**2 hour private shoot with Elle for $300 -  You pick the date and time.  Shoot with continuous lighting or Profoto Flash kit.  Your choice.

Email me directly for more information on private shoots - [masked]

** PLEASE ARRIVE NO EARLIER THAN 10 MINUTES BEFORE THE START TIMES (THERE'S NO SPACE TO HANG OUT IN THE STUDIO BEFORE THE WORKSHOP BEGINS)


*** YOU ARE ONLY CONFIRMED IF YOU PAID!!!!!!

results.description:
Dear friends,


This time we are running the meetup together with the NYC Hortonworks User Group.

results.description:
Please join us at Spark-NYC for this upcoming Cloudera talk.  The venue only accommodates 80 people, so please only RSVP here:  Spark-NYC

 In this talk: 

With Spark being used for more and more production workloads with stringent security requirements, fully locking down Spark applications has become critical. In this talk, you will learn the following facets of securing your spark application: 

1. Authentication – How spark utilizes kerberos for application authentication with the same delegation token mechanism used by Apache Hadoop.

2. Authorization – How spark integrates with Hive and Sentry to provide fine grained role based access control to data.

3. Encryption – How spark protects sensitive data by utilizing encryption on wire and on disk.

We will conclude with discussing open challenges and future work to improve overall security.

Kostas Sakellis is a Software Engineer and contributor to Apache Spark. Previous to that, he contributed to the extensibility effort on Cloudera Manager. Before Cloudera, Kostas did a 6 year stint at Amazon working across various teams including platform infrastructure. Kostas has a Bachelors of Mathematics in Computer Science from the University of Waterloo.
results.name: Securing Apache Spark on Production Hadoop Clusters

results.description:
Join fellow technologists, entrepreneurs, and investors for the NY Enterprise Technology Meetup's (NYETM) February meetup on Wednesday 2/17/16 from 6:30pm-9:00pm!

For our February meetup we have a panel discussion and two exciting companies demoing their technologies: 

Panel on "How to raise seed funding for your enterprise startup" with...

• Karin Klein, Partner at Bloomberg Beta

• Eliot Durbin, General Partner at Boldstart Ventures


• Mike Brown Jr., General Partner at Bowery Capital


• Brad Svrluga, General Partner at Primary Venture Partners


• Moderator: Vipin Chamakkala, Associate at Work-Bench


Demos


• Replicated - Replicated is a container-centric platform that enables software companies to manage & distribute an enterprise-grade, installable version of their product behind the firewall and into their customers' private data centers or private clouds. Replicated merges the concepts of cloud deployment into an on-prem delivery model that compliments cloud CI/CD processes. Additionally, Replicated provides features like licensing, updating,supportability, and LDAP unnecessary for the SaaS or open-source community versions. Replicated is currently powering the enterprise versions for several open source companies (npm, Travis CI, Sysdig, Circle CI, Code Climate, Waffle.io and others).

• HYPR - HYPR decentralizes the storage of biometric data to enable secure password-less authentication across mobile, desktop and IoT systems. As a fully interoperable solution, users may choose from a variety of biometric authentication methods by leveraging existing fingerprint sensors, cameras and microphones on mobile devices. HYPR is readily available as a cross-platform SDK for BYOD deployment, or as a tamper-proof security token for mission-critical settings.


Sign up today, and if you have any questions, please contact Jon Lehr at [masked]. 


Looking forward to seeing you all soon!

Yours in collaboration, 
Jon  
www.nyetm.com

results.description:
Venue accommodates 80 people, please RSVP only if you will attend. At this session, we will provide two 20-minute talks: 

Secure Spark: An update

With Spark being used for more and more production workloads with stringent security requirements, fully locking down Spark applications has become critical. We will begin by first providing a brief overview of basic security concepts including authentication and encryption. Next we will discuss recent improvements to Spark 1.6 to add native over-the-wire and on disk encryption using SASL. We will conclude by discussing remaining challenges and work items in Spark security.

Livy: A unified REST web service for Spark

Livy is an open source Apache licensed REST web service that manages long running Spark contexts in your cluster. By utilizing Livy, clients can easily submit:1. Spark jobs programmatically using a thin client2. Spark code snippets that are compiled and run in the cluster3. Entire Spark applications as JARsLivy effectively makes it possible to build both interactive web/mobile applications and multi-tenant notebooks. In this talk we will provide a brief overview of Livy, its architecture, APIs and future work and how you can contribute! 

Kostas Sakellis is a Software Engineer and contributor to Apache Spark. Previous to that, he contributed to the extensibility effort on Cloudera Manager. Before Cloudera, Kostas did a 6 year stint at Amazon working across various teams including platform infrastructure. Kostas has a Bachelors of Mathematics in Computer Science from the University of Waterloo.
results.name: Securing Apache Spark on Production Hadoop Clusters

results.description:
Generally considered to be the foremost example of Italian Gothic horror, this darkly atmospheric black-and-white chiller put director Mario Bava on the international map and made the bewitchingBarbara Steele a star. Steele plays Princess Asa, a high priestess of Satan who is gruesomely executed in 1600s Moldavia by having a spiked mask hammered into her face. Before she dies, Asa vows revenge on the family who killed her and returns from the grave two centuries later to keep her promise. In a striking resurrection scene replete with bats, scorpions and fog, Asa rises from the tomb to claim her bloody vengeance. With vampires, bubbling flesh, dank crypts, undead servants and torch-bearing mobs, the plot is a little ripe, but the visuals are Bava's primary consideration. The atmosphere is so heavy and the imagery so dense that the film becomes nearly too rich in texture, but the sheer, ghastly beauty of it all is entrancing. Although this was only the second of Bava's twenty-six films as director, it is undoubtedly his best and the one upon which most of his considerable reputation rests.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p80c5FNTNeg

Would you like to get a job as a Product Manager? Join us for this free open doors session to get an overview of our part-time product management course curriculum, meet the lead instructor and have the chance to ask any additional questions that you might have about what it takes to become a product manager in New York City: 


http://www.productschool.com/ 


All our classes are compatible with a regular work schedule and our campus is conveniently located in Manhattan. This is not your traditional lecture class. Expect a healthy mix of group work, one-­on-­ones with mentors, and a hands­-on experience building your own digital product from end to end. 


The instructors are professionals with real-world experience working at renowned tech Companies like Google and LinkedIn, and other technology startups. We have assembled a list of local hiring partners who are eagerly looking for our top Product School students.

Timeline:
6:30 - 6:45 pm - Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:15 pm - Info Session
7:15 - 7:30 pm - Q & A
*wine & refreshments will be provided

Takeaways: 

• Meet the Product School Team and potential classmates 

• Get an overview of the curriculum and course objectives 

• Meet the Lead Instructor and hear about his background 


• Have the chance to ask Product School

Meet our instructor: 

Ravi Patel is a V.P. Product Management at OpenSlate, an advertising technology startup. Since moving to NYC in 2009, he has led product management at AppNexus, Citigroup and his own startup. With a background in engineering and entrepreneurship, Ravi loves to focus on iterative testing and prototyping, customer development, and shipping user-centric products in agile environments. In his spare time, he enjoys visiting new coffee shops, walking around the city, and escaping to the mountains to snowboard.

Where: 

Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine.

results.description:
Join us for our first Consulting Networking Event of 2016 which will feature highly accomplished leaders from top management consulting firms including Capgemini, Slalom & Wipro. While our events are focused on consultants, we are a very inclusive community and open to anyone interested in the consulting profession - from management consultants, business professionals, technology/startup consultants, independent consultants to students looking to get into consulting. Most of our events attract a mix of all of these groups; both, women and men are welcome to attend. Food, drink and great networking opportunities await you! 


The topic of the panel discussion at this event is: Trends in the consulting industry in 2016 and beyond.

Panel Speakers 

Sheetal Chawla is a Vice President with Capgemini Consulting.


She leads Digital and Commercial Strategy in the North America Life Sciences Practice. Her background is a unique mix of management consulting, business strategy and industry—enabling her to bring a differentiated perspective on the complex and rapidly changing industry.  She has more than 13 years of experience in strategy development, market analytics, marketing and business valuation. In her role, she advises executive leaders on commercial, launch and patient strategies, digital transformation, and portfolio / profit optimization, among other topics. In 2015, Sheetal won the Women of Excellence Rising Star Award by the National Association for Female Executives (NAFE) for her efforts in developing diverse and impactful leaders.  She holds a BA and Executive MBA from The Johns Hopkins University.

Chris McGrath is General Manager at Slalom, NYC.

Chris McGrath, General Manager of Slalom New York, has over 27 years of consulting experience and launched the New York office in 2011.  Prior to joining Slalom, Chris was a Partner at Accenture in the Communications and High Tech Industry Group where he lead the Systems Integration Practice.  Chris has a B.S in Business Administration from Washington University and lives in NJ with his wife and four children.

Anoop Chawla is a HCM Consulting Leader at Wipro Consulting.

Anoop is a senior leader in Wipro's HCM consulting practice with 16+ years of experience in the industry. He is primarily focused on enabling large enterprises improve their HR service delivery by moving to the cloud and leveraging shared services centers across globe. Anoop brings deep understanding of the HCM and HR technology domain including Workday, Successfactors, and the Oracle HCM cloud. He previously also held multiple engagement manager positions at Infosys.

Join us at Dev Boot Camp NYC for a discussion about taking the leap, charting your course, and forming your ideas into an actual business. The panel will include entrepreneurs from the community and the discussion will center on the the different pathways for becoming an entrepreneur.

The last 10 minutes of the discussion will be set aside to hear your ideas in a round of lightening pitches.

We look forward to seeing you there!

6:30pm Arrive
7:00pm Panel Discussion
8:00pm Networking

About our Panelists:

Maureen Erokwu


Maureen Erokwu, Founder and CEO of Vosmap, has spent years bringing immersive Street View technology to the world. Listed as Inc’s “9 Awesome Women Black Tech Founders To Watch," Maureen’s passion for Virtual Reality (VR) technologies has allowed her to find entrepreneurial success despite the male­ dominated landscape of the industry. She brings years of expertise in the Small Business and Street View technology sectors and has worked with hundreds of brands including M

ercedes-Benz, Polo Ralph Lauren, and The Walt Disney Company. Maureen is a fierce advocate for women in technology and serves as a proud advisor for Lesbians Who Tech. She has taken her passion for technology to DC as a White House LGBTQ Tech Innovation Fellow and joins the ranks of other powerful women as a 2014 Focus Fellow. Listed as Inc’s “9 Awesome Women Black Tech Founders To Watch," her accomplishments have won her mentions in Tech Crunch, Pando Daily, Alley Watch, and People Magazine.

In her free time, Maureen feels most fulfilled when helping other entrepreneurs find their personal leadership. You can also find her on twitter encouraging women to be unafraid to enter the technology field. @merokwu


Michael Angelo DeCarlo
Michael Angelo has a passion for marrying artistic creativity and intellect, which took him from a career in performing opera to Frontend Web Development at Time, Inc. As a developer he enjoys fusing those skills to create unique experiences. He believes that understanding where to focus, what the proper tool for the job is, attention to detail, and simplistic and clean UI is often the key to a great product.

Darrell Silver
Darrell Silver is co-founder and CEO of Thinkful, the largest online coding bootcamp. Prior to Thinkful Darrell founded Perpetually, which was acquired in 2012 by Dell. He began his career in finance joining The Clinton Group, and becaming the head of algorithmic trade execution.

About our Moderator:

Sean Apparicio 
Sean is the founder of One+Love. One+Love is a geo-local mobile LGBT community center---connecting users to local events, supportive online community, entertainment, lifestyle and news that reflect and celebrate diverse sexual and gender identities.


Before forming One+Love, Sean was  multidisciplinary creative director specializing in digital media, commercial direction, Branding and Marketing Strategy. He has over 17 years of award winning industry experience. He's re-launched multiple brands, strengthened their visual identity and introduced current trends in technology to develop solutions for his clients. Most notably, under his direction, the BET Redesign won 11 Tellys and a Promax/BDA Diverse Voices Award.


Sean has worked for over 26 years as an advocate and activist for LGBTQ issues.  He’s done outreach and community organizing with the Audre Lorde Project, the Sylvia Rivera Law Project, and TransJustice. He has worked as a life coach at the Ali Forney Center; raised hell with ACT UP to raise HIV/AIDS awareness; mentored LGBTQ youth and lectured at UC Berkeley regarding coming out in the age of AIDS; provided safer sex education via the National AIDS Treatment Advocacy Project; served in a harm reduction center for at-risk clients; and has worked to become a griot of U.S.  LGBTQ history.

Join us for an evening with team members from Dropbox and SaltStack. Talks will start at 7pm.


Zviad Metreveli, Dropbox: Leveraging Docker to run unit and integration tests in full isolation, achieving much higher stability and reproducibility.


Zviad is a principal engineer in the infrastructure team at Dropbox NYC, currently working with the bulk storage team. Previously has worked on and contributed to different parts of Dropbox infrastructure, from error and crash reporting systems to deployment and testing frameworks, distributed databases and various other core systems that power Dropbox behind the scenes.

In this talk Zviad will provide an overview of IsoTester, a docker-powered framework for running unit and integration tests. IsoTester helps standardize testing across different languages and provides a way to run even complex integration tests in a cleaner, more reproducible environment either locally or remotely in a continuous integration system.

Dave Giles, SaltStack: Using Salt to manage/orchestrate Docker containers

Dave Giles has been a Solutions Consultant with SaltStack covering the Eastern US for the last 1.5 years.  Prior to SaltStack, Dave has worked in the Systems Management space with IBM, Symantec, and Altiris since 2000 and in the general tech industry since 1990.

In this talk Dave will provide an introduction of the Salt project, its background, components, and architecture, along with a demo use case of building a NGINX farm in docker containers behind a HAPROXY instance.  Also a use case around spinning up a Salt Master instance inside a container using KiteMatic.

_ _ _ _

** There will also be a quick update on next month's Docker Birthday Celebration. If you'd like to get involved (sponsorship, mentorship, volunteering) be sure to let us know.

Sponsors


Sabey is a privately held real estate development and investment company specializing in mission critical and other technical space for the data center, medical and life sciences, education, government and military sectors.

Dropbox works the way you do. Get to all your files from anywhere, on any device, and share them with anyone.

SaltStack software orchestrates the build and ongoing management of any modern infrastructure. SaltStack is also the most scalable and flexible configuration management software for event-driven automation of CloudOps, ITOps and DevOps.
results.name: SaltStack + Dropbox
