results.description:
Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our Real Estate Investing Community, Training & Income Opportunity!

group.name: The NYC Real Estate Investors Success Meetup Group

results.description:
New to the Real Estate Investing arena?

Just getting your feet wet?

Have you done a deal but it didn’t turn out as you expected?

Over the years we've been assisting individuals become real estate investors, one of the most asked questions has been, "How Do I Get Started in Real Estate Investing?"

Sometimes real estate investing can be scary and it’s easy to get lost in all the books, blogs, seminars, and television gurus. Our main objective is to help you overcome your fears and your countless questions by providing as much education and hands on coaching as possible to help you make the best decisions for your own needs.

Knowledge is YOUR most important currency.

Why do the rich keep getting richer? Wealthy people simply do things differently. Money doesn't make people rich. Knowledge makes people rich.

Financial knowledge – which is never taught in school - can never be taken away from you. It gives you the ability to create cash flow for you and your family no matter what happens to the rest of the economy.

At this event, we will discuss various investment strategies with a focus on ways to create cash flow through real estate as well as other ways to make money in Real Estate. We will also introduce you to the same strategies and ways of thinking about money that successful entrepreneurs have consistently used to create wealth.

Everyone wants to be wealthy, but only a select few will ever TAKE ACTION and get the financial knowledge they need to make their dreams come true. You can be part of the few elite people that choose to Take Action! Your First Step to Financial Freedom is to register for this event.

Choose ACTION. Create SUCCESS.

When will you begin??
results.how_to_find_us: Midtown Manhattan - 5th Ave

Ilya Polokhin: Ilya has built an amazing motion simulator.  It's awesome.  You don't want to miss it.  Enough Said. https://youtu.be/_5hDcz0MRwU

Augment:  Today, we are just at the tip of the iceberg for what businesses can do with augmented reality and virtual reality.  This presentation by Augment, the leading Augmented Reality platform, will highlight what brands are doing today with augmented reality to propel their businesses forward.  (Keeping in mind that AR and VR exist on a continuum – on one end you have virtual reality, on the other end you have the real world and in the middle you have augmented reality.)  Whether companies are using AR as a digital sales aid for their sales teams or creating engaging interactive print campaigns, Augment's team will demo a wide spectrum of use cases across a wide breadth of industries.  We will also discuss what businesses can look forward to in the AR/VR space in the year to come. 

Pandora: From the initial 3D designs, to selling Real Estate Development Projects to investors and potential tenants, VR and AR can make your presentation more intimate and visceral and give you both a better presentation of what your property entails. As Pandora, we are this upcoming tech and making VR and AR models available on every device.

results.description:
DESCRIPTION: This monthly meetup covers algorithms. We'll split attendees into two main groups:

Whiteboarding skills : You'll solve algorithms in small groups, breaking off into your preferred programming language and working together to find a solution. Problems are provided and vary in difficulty, check out the Github for examples of past problems: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Beginners : You'll pair with other members and practice answering easier algo questions. This group will be led by a more experienced developer who will help you out when you get stuck.

Schedule: 
6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code 
7:05 Welcome from Betterment and a short intro talk from Stefania Druga (@stefania_druga) called "Recommender Engines and the Algorithms That Back Them"!
7:15 Meetup starts 
9:30 Event ends after solution presentation from volunteers

Resources: The WWCNYC Github contains questions (and solutions) from past events, as well as upcoming problems! Submit solutions, contribute interview questions and more: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Other resources: 

http://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~kelu/interviews/questions.html
http://katemats.com/interview-questions/
http://meetupresources.herokuapp.com/index.html
http://codingforinterviews.com/practice

Resources for beginners or anyone who needs to review:

http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/algorithms-and-data-structures--cms-20437
http://www.nczonline.net/blog/tag/algorithms/

For our beginners, we recommend creating accounts on either http://jsbin.com/ or http://codepen.io/, to give you an place to practice your algorithms problem-solving skills.

HOST: Betterment is the fastest-growing automated investing service, helping people to better manage, protect, and grow their wealth through smarter technology. The service offers a globally diversified portfolio of ETFs, designed to help provide you with the best possible expected returns for retirement planning, building wealth, and other savings goals. Betterment is a CNBC Disruptor 50 and Webby award winner and has been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, and the Wall Street Journal. Betterment helps people to achieve a smarter financial future with minimal effort and for a fraction of the cost of traditional financial services.

WWCode events are intended for all women (trans and cis), trans men, and genderqueer folks who are interested in attending. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly and committed to matters of social justice as an organization. Select events may be open to the general public, which will be clearly noted in event descriptions. Our Code of Conduct is in effect at all of our events. If you have any questions, please message the Directors of this chapter.
results.name: Algorithms @ Betterment

results.description:
The 21st century is a time with an unprecedented expansion of ideas, culture, technology, information, and global justice. Compared to any other point in history, humans are flourishing. Yet the way in which we think about the world—and our shared future in it—has not accelerated at the same pace. Join us to find out why the future is awesome, and what you can do about it.

[This is an extended version of Paul's 2015 OSCON keynote.  Please stay after for an impromptu NY.pm social meeting.]

About Paul Fenwick:

Paul Fenwick is the managing director of Perl Training Australia, and has been teaching computer science for over a decade. He is an internationally acclaimed presenter at conferences and user groups worldwide, where he is well-known for his humour and off-beat topics. In his spare time, Paul’s interests include security, mycology, cycling, coffee, scuba diving, and lexically-scoped user pragmata.
results.name: Paul Fenwick: The Future is Awesome

results.description:
Would you like to meet a group of local successful Real Estate investors who are reaping all the benefits of a once in a lifetime buyers market?

At this meeting we will discuss why there are more millionaires created through real estate than all other industries combined. Right now we're in a once in a lifetime Real Estate buyers market which is helping to fuel our expansion. The combination of record low mortgage rates and underpriced housing values is why our group is making a killing in this market. Even the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to buy real estate.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address. 

You will have the opportunity to:

• Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

• Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax saving strategies out there. 

• Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Short Sales, Lease Options, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures, Seller Financed Notes, and Multi-Family Dwellings.

• Learn how to be your own boss. 

• Learn how to build massive wealth strategies such as Fix and Flips and passive wealth with Rental Properties.

• And so much more

We will show you a few deals we've completed recently & explain how you can be included in the deals we have going forward. We will also show you how can become part of our network and be coached and mentored by seasoned real estate mentors so you can complete deals of your own. Each meeting is different as we discuss different deals we've closed.

Some of our members invest part time for residual income while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to make consistent $10,000 or more per month please register for this event. We have a wide network of Real Estate Investors local to the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address.

results.description:
This is an encore discussion of the "Inequality (Part One)" discussions previously held on February 13, 2016.  THIS ENCORE DISCUSSION IS INTENDED FOR THOSE WHO DIDN'T ATTEND THE LAST ONE -- limited seats, so be sure to RSVP early!

----------------------------------------------------------------------


We'll discuss and explore the age-old notion of "Inequality" in terms of:

• Age

• Disability -- mental and physical


• Economic and socioeconomic status


• Familial and martial status


• Felon status 


• Gender

• Nationality and "alienage"

• Political preference or affiliation


• Race

• Religion


• Sexual orientation

The subtopics will include:

• When is inequality just and when it is unjust?

• Is it moral and just to be in pursuit of an equal society with equal opportunities for all?

• How do we strive to be "A More Perfect Union" notwithstanding a sharp disagreement about inequality?

• Does the notion of "separate-but-equal" still exist in certain fabrics of our society?

• Inequality by de jure vs. de facto means -- does it matter?

• What is the proper role of the government in balancing the competing forces?

*** Also to the extent possible and applicable -- we'll discuss these themes in the context of the 2016 Presidential Race.

***If we run out of time to cover the above list, we'll continue the discussions in Part Two.
results.name: [ENCORE] Philosophy & Politics: Is "Inequality"­­ inherently unjust? (Part I)

This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

results.description:
What is this all about?


GAL is hosting it's first event and we want you to be a part of it! Join us for an evening of fun that includes tech talks from GA WDI (Web Development Immersive) alumni, show and tell where you can demo the cool stuff you're working on, and booze!

Schedule for the night:

•  6:30 - 6:40 - Intro​ 

•  ​6:50 - 7:35 - GA WDI Alumni Panelists​ 

•  ​7:45 - 8:10 - Show/Tell

• ​ 8:10 - 9:10 - Social Time (Drinks and Food)

Who are the panelists?

• Anya Glowa-Kollisch: Jr. Developer @ ShopKeep

• Emily Lorddahl: Marketing Engineer @ Conversocial 

• Kamari Sykes: Software Development Engineer @ Time Inc. 

• Anna Rankin: Former IA @ General Assembly 

What is Show and Tell?

results.description:
Sorry for the short notice folks, I had a speaker delay and then eventually bail but I didn't want to go a month without a meeting so I'll be giving the talk I gave at BuildStuff LT. 

Traditional approaches in anti-money laundering involve simple matching algorithms and a lot of human review. However, in recent years this approach has proven to not scale well with the ever increasingly strict regulatory environment. We at Bayard Rock have had much success at applying fancier approaches, including some machine learning, to this problem. In this talk I walk you through the general problem domain and talk about some of the algorithms we use. I’ll also dip into why and how we leverage typed functional programming for rapid iteration with a small team in order to out-innovate our competitors.

Schedule

- 6:30 Doors Open, Pizza Time

- 7:00 Talk Begins

results.description:
Who are you?  Does this simple question have a simple answer? Our sense of identity can have a tremendous influence on our actions.  The things that we consider important, the things that make us happy, the things that make us sad - all of these things are rooted in some sense of personal identity.


But how does one examine this most primal question?  What defines who we are?  Is it the work we do, the things we own, the emotions we feel, the passions we pursue?  Is it our body, our mind, or our heart?  Is it any one of these things or some combination in between?


Is it possible to realize our full potential without examining who we are at the deepest level?  Can we deconstruct ourselves to come up with an answer that satisfies this question?  In this meetup, we will explore this question through guided activity and open conversation.  We’ll endeavor to understand ourselves on a deeper level through the lens of each others perspective. Please join us for an evening of lively interaction as we explore the question: who are you?


How it works...  

This gathering is part open table discussion and part structured interaction with a focus on directly experiencing of the subject matter at hand.  Anyone is welcome to join us for an evening of creativity and fun.
results.name: Who are you?

results.description:
Please RSVP for the event here. 

Introduction: 


Do you want to take your marketing skills to the next level? Do you have an event/small business and want to send a customized newsletter to your friends/customers? Building an email newsletter is different than building a web page but you use the same language in HTML and CSS. In this class, you'll learn the fundamental techniques to build out a simple email newsletter in HTML and CSS in under two hours!


Key Takeaways:


Learn how to build well laid-out email newsletters through the use of tags and tables
Add an image to your email newsletter
Learn about the workflow of creating email newsletters including shipping and testing newsletters
Build an email newsletter in HTML/CSS bu the end of class
Preparation:
Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook)
Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the homepage).
Light snacks will be provided
This event is open to all adult (18+) beginners 


Meet Your Instructor


Samantha Vinci: Samantha is a developer and designer. She currently works at Brooklyn Law School, where she builds email invitations and newsletters. She also helps teach a Front End Development class which provides tech-adjacent professionals with the skills they need to communicate effectively with their colleagues.

results.description:
Join Licensed Soul Therapist Carolyn Goldfarb for a three hour gathering of women exploring how to connect to your true authentic expression. The benefits are astounding! Sharing your core truth and living your purpose is deeply pleasurable and incredibly satisfying. Most women are blocked from accessing her core power, her true awareness of self. Soul Therapy is an evolutionary embodiment of exploring your humanness from the SOUL level.

During our time together you will be asked five questions that will lead you into greater awareness of who you are, why you get stuck, what your soul wants to communicate to you, how to manifest your dreams and how to love yourself. If you have ever wanted to tap into your unlimited potentiality and be happy in the flow of life with less stress, now is the time to do so.

Your soul is the guardian and gatekeeper to your true self. Your authentic voice is the one main requirement that resides within you and provides ample opportunities for you to listen, grow and expand. Most people don’t know how to listen or understand how to embrace your soul’s wisdom and knowledge. Soul Therapy Seminars are designed to show you how to remove the barriers that stop you from experiencing and loving a fully expressed, evolutionary life!

Carolyn Goldfarb will support and guide you along the way.

http://www.soultherapyschool.com/carolyn

results.description:
Do you want to live a resilient life, full of energy and joy?

Do you want to wake up with purpose and tons of passion?

Do you want to gain control over your thoughts and emotions?

This night is going to be an absolute game changer! You will learn ancient thousands of years old techniques that will help you identify exactly what has been keeping you stuck from achieving happiness, abundance, joy, wealth and love.

You're guaranteed to leave with a heart opening experience and tools you can use in your everyday life to instantly bring you into a joyful and energized state.

You will be guided through a series of meditation processes that will leave you with an experience you've never felt before. Many have stated to have experienced "God" while attending this workshop. 

You don't want to miss this! Bring your friends and family along for the ride! 


Testimonials from previous Life Transformers: 

"While attending Ayelet's webinar we were guided through a visualization technique to create the best version of who we will become in 10 years from now. In the middle of that awesome visualization I felt a burst, a huge leap of energy expanding in my heart chakra (and since I am an energy healer it makes so much sense). Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. I can feel at ease knowing I have this new tool in my hands, it's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I wanted to first thank you for hosting this. I have been doing a lot of things, such as the law of attraction, access consciousness, and yoga, and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I love how you said to write down all your thoughts/ lists about yourself, as well as goals, to see where the conflicts lie. I haven't really come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a free Lust to Love Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

Ayelet (www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron) is a relationship expert. I asked for her advice regarding my recent breakup with my boyfriend of six years, which is why I went to her event. Ayelet explained that we have a tendency to constantly chase guys who don't treat us right, and we have expectations of other people that in turn, create unhappiness in our lives. Working on the root chakra helps us let go of those expectations and find inner peace.

The meditation event helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The free meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC
results.name: The Ultimate Technique for Removing Doubt & Breaking Habits

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. results.description:
Intimacy: Making Relationships Meaningful

with Kadam Peter

Why do relationships seem to cause us so many difficulties? Why does attachment keep us trapped in painful cycles, making it hard to love and cherish others? This series will help strengthen, deepen or revitalize our relationships. Create fulfilling and vibrant connections with restored intimacy, joy, and generosity.  Join our sangha (our spiritual community) as we learn to develop warm, vital relationships in our journey toward wholeness and freedom.

Kadam Peter Kurczynski is the resident teacher of Dharmachakra BuddhistCenter. He has been practicing Buddhism in formal study programs of the New Kadampa Tradition for nearly twenty years. His teachings are timely, practical and easy to apply in everyday life.  In 2013, he received the title “Kadam,” meaning senior lay resident teacher. Kadam Peter has participated in numerous meditation retreats, and regularly attends international festivals of Kadampa Buddhism.

$15.00 suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
Join DM Tom Gilbert in his first Wildpig RPG!

A pale body lays among the dark leaves, the blood long since cooled in the late autumn chill. Frost is forming on the ground, coating the corpse in silver. It shines in the dawn light, while the dark red blood freezes on her neck. In the nearby village of Lyalintsi, Magister Illian Antonov is about to discover his daughter is missing. Another young girl from his community is gone, and he must face his people with no more answers than before. The darkness of the forest is closing in on the village, and the night is full of horrors. The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. Maya Antonov is Dead is a campaign for D&D 5E. The focus is on the horror surrounding the players, and the challenge of surviving in a world set against them. Characters will begin at first level, and advancement will be challenging.

Races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, Halfling, Tiefling.
Classes: Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Warlock, Wizard
results.name: D&D 5E: Maya Antonov is Dead session 6

results.description:
By an overwhelming margin - we're reading Neil Gaiman's The Ocean at the End of the Lane in Feb! (a short book for a short month!)

From Goodreads:


Sussex, England. A middle-aged man returns to his childhood home to attend a funeral. Although the house he lived in is long gone, he is drawn to the farm at the end of the road, where, when he was seven, he encountered a most remarkable girl, Lettie Hempstock, and her mother and grandmother. He hasn't thought of Lettie in decades, and yet as he sits by the pond (a pond that she'd claimed was an ocean) behind the ramshackle old farmhouse, the unremembered past comes flooding back. And it is a past too strange, too frightening, too dangerous to have happened to anyone, let alone a small boy.

Forty years earlier, a man committed suicide in a stolen car at this farm at the end of the road. Like a fuse on a firework, his death lit a touchpaper and resonated in unimaginable ways. The darkness was unleashed, something scary and thoroughly incomprehensible to a little boy. And Lettie—magical, comforting, wise beyond her years—promised to protect him, no matter what.
results.name: February Book Club - The Ocean at the End of the Lane

results.description:
Love brazilian music? This workshop is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this workshop.
This is a one hour workshop with the option of performing three songs May 1st at Arlene's Grocery.
Obrigada!
results.name: Brazilian Guitar Workshop

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 29-42-- 1M/3F SPOTS LEFT

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Abstract:

For nearly half a century, AI has always seemed as if it just beyond reach, less, than two decades away. Yet "strong AI" in some ways still seems elusive. In this talk, I will give a cognitive scientist's perspective on AI. What have we learned, and what are we still struggling with? Is there anything that researchers of AI can still learn from studying the science of human cognition?

Speaker Bio:

Gary Marcus, scientist, bestselling author, and entrepreneur, is Professor of Psychology and Neural Science at NYU and CEO and Co-Founder of the recently-formed Geometric Intelligence, Inc. 

His research on language, computation, artificial intelligence, and cognitive development has been published widely, in leading journals such as Scienceand Nature. He is also the author of four books including The Algebraic Mind, Kluge:The Haphazard Evolution of the Human Mind, and The New York Times Bestseller, Guitar Zero, and contributes frequently to the The New Yorker and The New York Times. 

His recent book,The Future of the Brain: Essays By The World's Leading Neuroscientists, features the 2014 Nobel Laureates May-Britt and Edvard Moser. His efforts to update the Turing Test have spurred a worldwide movement.
results.name: Making AI more Human

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

NEDs monthly Roundtable brings together all levels of Executive Directors for high-value interactions that make a difference to your organization and your career.

Executive Director is a critical position in a nonprofit and sometimes it seems that you’re supposed to have all the answers. How knowledgeable could you be if you had hundreds of years of ED experience behind you? Joining our Roundtable will give you that.

results.description:
TICKETS ON OUR SITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite (purchased through our site) to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

THE PATH TO PROTOTYPING

Create Your 2016 Website & App Prototype, Easily and Without Coding.

Presented by Ian Micallef, Designer</a>



Price: <a href="http://www.designersandgeeks.com/events/path-to-prototyping?utm_source=makesenseofanymess_meetup&utm_medium=meetup&utm_campaign=meetup_nyc">$15 for early birds, $20 for regular


Have you ever wanted to be able to share that app or website idea that you haven’t been able to stop thinking about? You can draw it, but now you have the ability to bring it to life. Make your images talk together, showing how your idea would work in real life, using the latest, free prototyping tools.

Ian Micallef is an American award-winning designer, currently living in New York City. He’s had the privilege of leading designs at HBO, Sony Music, Discovery Channel, Marsh & McLennan Companies and more. His clients have included Bob Dylan, John Mayer, Daft Punk, J. Cole, Lionel Richie, John Legend, Phish, and Hard Summer Festival amongst many others. He is also a member of the American Institute of Graphic Arts (AIGA) and the Art Directors Club of NYC (ADC).


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 29-42 - 1f/1m spots left

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 29-42 -2F/2M spots left

results.description:
I. Agenda, Introductions & Challenges Forum (7:00 PM) 


A. Mix & Mingle - Time to get coffee or a snack, settle in and complete the Challenges Forum signup form before the GTDNYC Meetup begins. Please arrive in enough time so we can secure the appropriate seating!

B. Introductions - Each member will introduce yourself briefly, tell us what you do professionally, your GTD experience, and a recent success with your productivity implementation and/or life.

C. Challenges Forum - We'll give a few minutes to have the group help each member with solutions to challenges we may be facing currently with life or work circumstances with our productivity system. These are specific productivity challenges and only one challenge per member for time's sake.

II. Discussion: Quantified Self, Digital Technology and GTD (~8:20 - 8:45 PM)

https://youtu.be/OrAo8oBBFIo


The Quantified Self (a/k/a "lifelogging" or "self-tracking," among other terms) is a movement whereby individuals have been learning how to measure various aspects of themselves for greater knowledge of one's self.

I began self-tracking several areas of my life in the 1990s in a manual way and had no idea that such a thing was possible through technology and wearable technology. Today, in contrast, we have smartphones, Google Fit and FitBit that can track our movements and exercise, smartwatches that can monitor our heart rates (with varying accuracy), apps that can photograph our food and identify its nutritional values, and more. As a Q-Selfer, I use the data I garner from this self-tracking for personal productivity and performance whenever I am looking at how my GTD-inspired productivity system is working.

How do you use self-tracking in your own life? How might you start to use the principles of Quantified Self to monitor your inputs, states, and performance? How can this inform your own GTD-inspired practice and system? Those will be the main discussion points of our upcoming Meetup! I hope you can join us for this fascinating topic.

Please feel free to bring your copy of GTD for reference, your questions and thoughts on problem-solving as well! Your conversation contributions are what make the discussions awesome!

III. GTD Resource Sharing (8:45 PM) -- CATEGORY: Health/Fitness

This is where everyone can offer a book title, recent blog or magazine article, tip/trick/hack, tool, smartphone app, service or item that has helped them in their life productively either with GTD or otherwise. The above category is a recommended focus for sharing, but you may share any productivity resource that has helped you on your GTD journey. (We compile resources discussed and post them to our Resources Page in the GTDNYC Google Group. Join us there!)

I encourage everyone to bring some kind of GTD or personal productivity resource they know about or use to offer to the group!

IV. Announcements / Closing Remarks (8:50 PM)

Upcoming Meetup events, and additional programs, announcements will be given. If you are not receiving the Meetup notifications about Meetups and our other productivity activities (e.g., Productivity Book Group, #ProdChat, the weekly Twitter chat, and Productivity Café), please sign up directly here for email notifications. All announcements must be sent to the Meetup Organizer via a Meetup message to announce to the group, at his/her sole discretion. Thank you!

Do you mind helping support this Meetup? This free Meetup can now receive small contributions to help it grow. Chip in here: https://secure.meetup.com/gtdnyc/contribute/
results.name: Quantified Self, Digital Technology and GTD | GTD NYC

results.description:
I would love to make some cool pillow cases in this class, does anyone else want to join me?

Rawan Rihani of Aurora Botanica will be leading an exploratory natural dye class working with different Shibori and Itajime with Indigo. Through folding, wrapping, clamping, gathering the fabric we can create different patterns and expressive design with indigo on cotton. We will provide all dye as well as 2 yards of cotton fabric per student. We encourage you to bring up to 3 of your own pieces to dye as well: curtains, white shirts, scarves, sheets, dresses, pillowcases... all silk, linen, wool, and cotton fabrics will take the natural indigo dye. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/uE7OJ2
results.name: Exploratory Indigo Natural Dye Class!

results.description:
Come play with RFID and NFC chips as we deconstruct the technology, read and write to NFC and RFID cards, and learn through doing about how RFID systems can be used in projects and de-mystified in the real world. This isn't a formal class but mostly a night to set aside time to work on RFID related projects that have been pending and also to get inspired for what you could create from it.

For example, I want to read my work proximity pass and build a productivity clock which also fills out my time and hours and subdivides the time and hours based on time spent on each task and project. Another RFID project is a workbench inventory management system which bins with RFID tags have components or supplies stored in them and the shelf knows how many are in which bin at what location no matter where you put the bin back. This is a fun project-driven night and we will definitely set up reading and writing of RFID and NFC devices. **This event is hosted by Hoboken MakerBar NOT CfN.

NO CONTRACT NO REGISTRATION pay the months you attend! unlimited soccer $50 (First 20 people to sign up only)

Want to play soccer, burn some energy? Release some stress? Play the sport you LOVE? Then come join us at SOCCER R US Indoor soccer facility, catering services to all you soccer players! COED PICK UP SOCCER. Come experience an awesome YEAR ROUND Indoor soccer facility in Brooklyn NEW YORK. Prospect Park train station on the Q OR B Train or S shuttle. Indoor Soccer Facility with Real Turf Right by Prospect Park (Elevator available for bike riders)

FUTSAL In the Morning Before Work, During Lunch and Late Evenings

Start time Vary So stay Tuned and look out for the time slots that suit you best

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip.

results.description:
In this session you will learn how to connect the Arduino to a few sensors (temperature and light) and outputs (servo motor and led) and control (outputs) or monitor(sensors) remotely.  Types of communications to be covered are Infrared, bluetooth, serial, I2C, and internet.

Reviews from our previous courses:


• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We will provide laptops and Arduinos for participants.

About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course

results.name: Arduino, Communications, and The Internet of Things (IoT)

results.description:
Come play with RFID and NFC chips as we deconstruct the technology, read and write to NFC and RFID cards, and learn through doing about how RFID systems can be used in projects and de-mystified in the real world. This isn't a formal class but mostly a night to set aside time to work on RFID related projects that have been pending and also to get inspired for what you could create from it.

For example, I want to read my work proximity pass and build a productivity clock which also fills out my time and hours and subdivides the time and hours based on time spent on each task and project. Another RFID project is a workbench inventory management system which bins with RFID tags have components or supplies stored in them and the shelf knows how many are in which bin at what location no matter where you put the bin back. This is a fun project-driven night and we will definitely set up reading and writing of RFID and NFC devices. Come join us!

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
We'll have a special guest speaker, Tanner Reid. Tanner is an Autodesk Product Design Engineer who will talk to us about what Fusion 360 can do , and where it's headed. 

So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Model Spotlight: Badass Glamour, Lingerie & Implied Shoot w/Jenny - Feb. 18th"


We are back at it again with our first weekday shoot this year. What better way to spend winter than with an evening shoot with none other than Jenny Ettie Barr! She always bring enthusiasm and creativity to her shoots and we are happy to spotlight her this month. 

About Model Spotlight Shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Limited smaller group than our bigger shoots) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, sets, add props and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (I will be on hand to help where needed.)

About the Shoot:

We have three look planned. The first is a concept idea..we are thinking of an edgy, badass look. (Camouflage, vinyl pants, fake guns, etc) But with a sexy glamour twist, of course. The second is lingerie look using our LED lighting for a more moody look. The third is an implied look. (TBD...will update info soon)

RSVP:

Please take a moment to read the new Deposit info below in the Policy and Disclaimers section. We have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit to hold your spot. (This also lets anyone on a waitlist able to join the shoot if you are not sure of your attendance yet.) Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page. All deposits need to be received immediately upon signup or within 5 days of the shoot or we will have to fill the unconfirmed spot/s ASAP or cancel the shoot (existing deposits returned) if the minimum RSVP is not met. (No, deposit is needed if you are on the waitlist but check back to see if your waitlist status has been updated to "Yes".)

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $20 (Paypal)

(Don't mark the checkbox on the PayPal page as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Model: 

Jenny Ettie Barr: Instagram

(Photo Credit: NandoPro)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the model/s beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. As the shoot date comes closer, if you have not paid the deposit, we will fill the unconfirmed spot immediately. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a waitlist, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Model Spotlight: Badass Glamour, Lingerie & Implied Shoot w/Jenny - Feb. 18th

We are looking forward to meeting new faces!

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.


Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?  Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday February 18th,  2016  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required!
